meanings.definition: A person who acts on behalf of another person or organization.
meanings.sent1: The subagent helped the company with their legal paperwork.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent appointed a subagent to show properties to potential buyers.
meanings.sent3: The subagent accidentally signed the wrong contract, causing a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She was like a subagent of efficiency, swiftly completing tasks on behalf of her team.
meanings.sent5: The diligent subagent diligently carried out all tasks assigned to them.

meanings.definition: An individual authorized to represent a principal in a specific transaction.
meanings.sent1: During the negotiation, the subagent spoke on behalf of the seller.
meanings.sent2: The subagent successfully closed the deal on behalf of the client.
meanings.sent3: The subagent's negotiation skills were so sharp, they could sell ice to an Eskimo!
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, time is a subagent that never stops working.
meanings.sent5: The subagent's confident demeanor inspired trust in all parties involved.

meanings.definition: A secondary agent appointed to assist a primary agent in carrying out duties.
meanings.sent1: The subagent supported the lead agent in organizing the event.
meanings.sent2: The primary agent relied on the subagent to handle logistics.
meanings.sent3: The subagent's quick thinking saved the day in a comical turn of events.
meanings.sent4: In the play of life, the subagent plays a crucial supporting role.
meanings.sent5: The subagent's dedication shone through in every task they undertook.
